intro: Ternstroemia landae, commonly known as the Länsi rainforest tree, is a species native to the tropical rainforests of Central America. It belongs to the Theaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 15 meters. Its leaves are elliptical in shape, with a glossy surface and prominent veins, while its flowers are usually white or pale pink. Ternstroemia landae plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
